info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 9:07AM CDT until June 27 at 5:58AM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
102 River at Rosendale affecting Andrew and Buchanan Counties.
Grand River near Pattonsburg affecting Daviess and Gentry Counties.
Platte River near Agency affecting Buchanan County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Grand River near Pattonsburg.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Low-lying farmland begins to flood. At 30.0 feet, Nearly all agricultural land and secondary roads in the Grand River floodplain flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 2.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 29.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
